'''On cartography, maps & locations in Middle-earth''' is a small collection of essays on Middle-earth, extracted from previous volumes published by Le Dragon de Brume and translated from French into English.

The volume is available in print, but a full PDF version is also provided on the editor's website. 

== Contents ==

* Turlin, J.-R. — "On the cartography of the Shire" pp. 7–74
* Willis, D. — "On Númenor and the Cottoniana" pp. 75–93
* Willis, D. —  [appendix] "On Tolkien and the Cotton library" pp. 95–99
* Willis, D. — "On assembling maps from Beleriand to Rhûn" pp. 100–139
* Lefèvre, A.* — "On imagination and visualization" pp. 140–144
* Willis, D. — "On the geolocation of Middle-earth" pp. 145–156
* "On the authors & contributors" p. 157
* "Supplementary material" pp. 158–162 (illus.)
